title: Norway appoints Stoltenberg, retains energy minister in reshuffle
subtitle: (Montel) Former Norwegian prime minister Jens Stoltenberg has made a surprise return to the frontline of the country’s politics as finance minister, prime minister Jonas Gahr Store announced on Tuesday, as he retained Terje Aasland as energy minister.
body:
Store announced eight new ministers today after his Labour party’s coalition government with the anti-EU Centre party collapsed last week in a row over EU energy policies, leaving Labour to govern alone until the September general election.
Stoltenberg led Nato for a decade until last year, where he was known for building a good relationship with Donald Trump during his first term as US president. His return to the front benches comes at a time when Norway faces the risk of tariffs from Trump in his second term.
He served as prime minster from 2000-2001 and between 2005-2013 and has also previously been both finance minister and energy minister.
